293445.description: Internet disconnects every 20â€“30 minutes after 10 PM. Customer has restarted router twice with no improvement.

notes.author: support_agent
notes.text: Suggested router power cycle and checked SNR logs.

notes.author: technician
notes.text: Detected packet loss spikes between 10 PM and 1 AM in backend monitoring.

882122.description: Customer claims extra â‚¹450 was charged without usage change.

notes.author: billing_team
notes.text: Requested previous invoice copy for validation.

110022.description: Speed test reports 50 Mbps while plan provides 100 Mbps.

notes.author: support_agent
notes.text: Plan upgraded to 150 Mbps with goodwill credit. Issue resolved.

765321.description: Connection drops and modem restarts automatically every 5â€“8 minutes.

notes.author: level1_support
notes.text: Suspected overheating or power supply failure.

553210.description: Internet down since 7 AM. Router reset did not help.

notes.author: dispatch_team
notes.text: Field technician scheduled for Feb 14 at 11 AM.

998877.issue: Wi-Fi range very weak in bedroom
998877.description: Signal strength drops when more than 10 meters from the router.

notes.author: support_agent
notes.text: Recommended repositioning router and checking interference.

120450.issue: Random packet loss during video calls
120450.description: Customer reports jitter and packet loss on Zoom calls.

notes.author: network_ops
notes.text: Investigating node congestion at peak hours.

notes.author: installation_team
notes.text: Waiting for pole clearance approval.

654233.description: Payment completed via UPI but plan did not activate.

notes.author: billing_team
notes.text: Payment gateway logs inconsistencies detected.

871290.description: Multiple customers affected. Expected resolution 48 hours.

notes.author: noc_team
notes.text: Damage reported due to construction dig. Field team dispatched.

998883.issue: WiFi dead zones at home; no internet coverage in bedroom and kitchen.
998883.description: WiFi dead zones at home; no internet coverage in bedroom and kitchen. Device: Netgear Nighthawk R7000

notes.author: customer
notes.text: WiFi dead zones at home; no internet coverage in bedroom and kitchen.

notes.author: customer
notes.text: Customer reports they have already tried moving the router to different locations, but the WiFi signal is still weak in bedroom and kitchen.

notes.author: customer
notes.text: Customer provided additional details: Router model is Netgear Nighthawk R7000, home is a 2-story house with router on the ground floor.

notes.author: support_agent
notes.text: Ticket reviewed. Issue escalated to High priority due to multiple room coverage problems. Recommended mesh system or WiFi extenders for 2-story home.

notes.author: technical_team
notes.text: Analyzed router placement recommendations. For Netgear Nighthawk R7000 in 2-story home, suggest: 1) Reposition router to central location on ground floor, 2) Use 2.4 GHz band for better range, 3) Consider mesh system if issue persists.

notes.author: customer
notes.text: slow internet speeds

notes.author: customer
notes.text: Customer tried restarting modem and router multiple times, but speeds are still slow.

notes.author: customer
notes.text: Customer has a 500 Mbps plan but is only getting around 50 Mbps. Modem is a Netgear CM1000 and router is a TP-Link Archer AX50. This started happening about 3 days ago.
